From Gaza to Amman, how UNRWA's family archives were rescued under fire
subhead: Documents attesting to the refugee status of hundreds of thousands of Palestinians were taken out of Gaza in the early months of the war and stored safely in Jordan. Le Monde tells the story of this previously unreported secret operation.

French nuclear energy splits Germany's ruling coalition
subhead: France has counted on a shift in Germany's nuclear policy ever since the arrival of conservative Friedrich Merz – whose party supports nuclear energy, unlike the Social Democratic Party – at the head of the coalition. Nuclear energy is expected to top the agenda at the July 23 meeting in Berlin between the German chancellor and the French president.

headline: Texas lawmakers meet to debate disaster management as fingers are pointed over floods
subhead: Kerr County, where 135 people lost their lives on July 4, had no alert system in place, as taxpayers had refused to fund it. Lawmakers are examining an overhaul of natural disaster management during a special session convened by the governor.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by… your wardrobe
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores playful games centered on the art of getting dressed – only to end up in little more than your underwear.

headline: Meet the face of France's anger against cancer and pesticides
subhead: Fleur Breteau was instrumental to the success of a petition demanding the repeal of a law that would reintroduce a banned pesticide, which surpassed one million signatures.

headline: Conor the parrot, a somber allegory for Ukraine's trauma
subhead: After the death of his owner, Anton, Conor withered and appeared to lose the will to live. Tatiana, the widow, could no longer bear to hear him speak in 'the same intonations' as Anton.
